render.tex: %text The derivative of $\sin x$ with respect to $\cos x$ is $-\cot x$%

reason.tex:
%text If $f(x) = \sin x$ and $g(x) = \cos x$, then we have to find $\dfrac{d}{d g} f(x)$ -- not $f'(x)$ or $g'(x)$ % \begin{align}
\frac{d}{dg} f(x) &= \dfrac{ df / dx}{dg / dx} = \dfrac{ \ddx \sin x}{\ddx \cos x} \\ &= \dfrac{\cos x}{-\sin x} = -\cot x \end{align} %text %
